abstract: Profile of Xu Shilin, 17-year-old who became the first Chinese player to be seeded No 1 in a Grand Slam singles event after receiving top spot in the junior girls' draw at the Australian Open; some speculate that Xu could rise to fill shoes of Li Na.
lead_paragraph: Xu, 17, was the first Chinese player to be seeded No. 1 in a Grand Slam singles event when she got the top spot in the junior girls’ draw at the Australian Open.
snippet: Xu, 17, was the first Chinese player to be seeded No. 1 in a Grand Slam singles event when she got the top spot in the junior girls’ draw at the Australian Open.

headline.main: Xu Shilin, a Young Chinese Player, Tries to Step Into the Void Left by Li Na
headline.print_headline: 17-Year-Old Tries to Step Into a Void
